It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its intricate and often showy floral structures. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or lithophyte, attaching itself to trees or rocks in its natural habitat. Its leaves are usually broad and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid conditions.
